textBeforeTable: Lusitan Originally Posted by The amount of glory you earn is dependent on your success in the battleground. This mostly complete table shows point distributions towards personal glory, and team score (you need 500 team score to win) In sPvP, you earn a currency called glory which is used to purchase equipment. The amount of glory you earn seems to be equal to the amount of rank points you get. Rank is simply a way to gauge the experience of a player, and every rank you will be given random PvP rewards. In sPvP, all players are only equal footing. Everyone is boosted to level 80, given the max amount of trait points, all utilities, and access to all the same gear. Progression through sPvP is done by cosmetic upgrades, not statistical ones. No PvE boost item is available in sPvP, nor can any item in sPvP be used for PvE. Player statistics, such as games played per profession, are tracked. Guild Wars 2 PvP is divided into two separate parts: Structured PvP and World vs. World vs. World.
